full_text:
Configuring Claim History

Lesson
objectives

Explain claim history functionality
Create custom claim history types
Create custom claim history records
Track individual field changes in Gosu

History records

| Demonstration G

History records

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Claim history

¢ Is an uneditable record of important events and actions taken on the claim

Gi

Includes obvious actions such as edits

« Also includes more trivial events such as viewing the claim

History

all
Type Related To
Viewed Entire claim
Viewed Entire claim
Flagged Entire claim

Datachange Entire claim

User

| History record

* Is an entry in the claim history, documenting a single recordable claim action or

event

* Every history record has these

fields:
* Type
* Related To
* User

« Event Time Stamp

History

All
Type Related To
Viewed Entire claim

* These fields are optional:

* Description
* Link

User Event Time Stamp +
Andy Applegate 08/03/2018 10:57 AM

Description

Gi

| Claim history type

Is the claim event causing the history record to be created

+ Example: Closing a claim is an event which produces a history record of
type “Closed”

History screen has a history type filter

+ Can search for history events of a particular type

ClaimCenter comes with standard history types which trigger
automatically created claim history records

+ Standard events include editing, assigning, viewing, approvals, and so
on

+ Some events are not included in history in the base application, such as
creating activities and creating reserves

ClaimCenter may be configured to have custom history types

+ This defines additional events which are added to the claim history

History

Gi

All

all
Activity due date changed
Activity escalation date moved
Approval or Rejection

Assigned

Catastrophe warning

Check deleted

Check stopped

Check transferred

Check voided

Closed

Custom

Opened

Policy edited

Policy selected or refreshed
Referred

* Can be viewed in the Data Dictionary or Studio lvisoonpers
* Cannot be edited sis area-ony fe

Question

,- — Whatis a ClaimCenter claim history record?

7
¢
¢

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Answer Gi

,- — Whatis a ClaimCenter claim history record?
y ¢
¢
The correct answer is an uneditable record of some important event or action taken on
the claim.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

Question

_- — !fno active rules write claim history records, will any claim history
¢ records be written?

¢
¢

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Answer

_- — !fno active rules write claim history records, will any claim history
Y records be written?
¢

The correct answer is yes, the base history types are automatically tracked, and do
not depend on rules.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

| Creating custom claim history types

¢ Must be added to CustomHistoryType typelist

* Defines history events that may be tracked by configured rules

¢ Many custom history types are predefined in the base application

* You can add new custom history types

Element

typelistextension

typecode
typecode
typecode
typecode
typecode
typecode
typecode
typecode

Code
CustomHistoryType
ante
ewner
Export
DataChange
create_recovery_bill
catastrophe
email

warning

Name

Custom history event type...

Auto: No fault rating
Exposure with no reserves
Exported to mainframe
Data change

Create recovery bill
Guidewire catastrophe rul...
Email sent

Warning

“Name” property appears
in the “type” column on the
Claim History screen.

| Recording custom history events Gi

* Create a preupdate rule that captures the history condition

¢ The action uses the createCustomHistoryEvent () method on Claim

¢ Syntax: Claim.createCustomHistoryEvent(CustomHistory Type. TC_CustomHistoryType, Text)
* Claim is the claim to which you are adding a history record
* CustomHistoryType is the history type
* Textis the text to be displayed in the history record’s description column (on the screen)

USES:

CONDITION (exposure : entity.Exposure) :

return exposure.ReserveLines.length == 0

ACTION (exposure : entity.Exposure, actions : gw.rules.Action):

| Testing fields for changes

¢« Use the isFieldChanged () method
° Syntax:
* entity.isFieldChanged(entity#field) or entity.isFieldChanged(field)

« Returns boolean

CONDITION (claim : entity.Claim):
return claim.isCoverageInQuestionFactorsNotEmpty ()

or flaim.isFieldChanged ("CoverageInQuestion")

| Finding original field values

Gi

¢ To determine the original value of a changed field, use the getoriginalvValue ()
method

¢ Syntax
entity.getOriginalValue(entity#field) or entity.getOriginalValue(field)

Returns an ordinary object

Need to cast the result in order
to get the display name

| Demonstration G

Custom history records

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

_— — |sit possible to define new types of history events?

7
¢
¢

SS eee eee ee Soo e Sse

Answer

_— — |sit possible to define new types of history events?
y ¢
¢
The correct answer is yes, by adding them to the CustomHistoryType typelist and
creating rules to record them.

Soe ee eon eee Soe e ese Ss

Track changes to salvage status
